entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:45PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ONGOING ERUPTIVE ACTIVITY AT SHISHALDIN VOLCANO COULD PRODUCE TRACE AMOUNTS OF ASHFALL IN FALSE PASS ALONG THE ALASKA PENINSULA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... The Alaska Volcano Observatory indicates that low level eruptive activity is ongoing this afternoon at Shishaldin Volcano. Low level cloud cover is blocking the view of nearby web cams.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Iowa, southwestern Columbia, northwestern Dane and southern Sauk Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sauk City to near Spring Green. Movement was southeast at 25 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:35PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Columbia, northeastern Dane and southwestern Dodge Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 735 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fall River to near Deforest. Movement was southeast at 20 mph.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Oconto and Shawano. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Tthunderstorms will affect portions of southern Brown, Calumet, Winnebago, southeastern Outagamie and northwestern Manitowoc Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 715 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Appleton to near Ripon. Movement was east at 30 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Green Lake, northeastern Columbia and northwestern Dodge Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cambria, or 13 miles east of Portage, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45-50 mph and pea size hail.
